> Just do assertEquals on expected and actual collections. The
> collections all have sensible equals methods
> 
> i.e. if the 2 collections are lists they will be equal if they
> contain the same elements in the same order. If the 2 collections
> are sets they will be equal if they contain the same elements.

The only problem with this otherwise great advice is that comparing two lists 
for the same elements, although not at the same indices, does not work.

This has been discussed, I think, to death somewhere on the web. Maybe you 
should look at http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?JavaUnitBestPractices and hunt around 
for something on comparing arrays or some such. There should be quite a 
complete discussion.

The basic idea is this: write your own custom assertion 
or "collectionsEquals", but be careful how to handle the differences. 
Especially for big collections, you need an easy way to know what the 
differences are between the collections in the case where they are not equal.

If that resource does not help you, then let us know and we'll fill in the 
blanks. This sounds like another "Tip and Trick" for my site. :)
